trial_identification.studytitle: DOES USE OF INHALED FLUTICASONE PRIOR TO AN ADENOSINE 5'MONOPHOSPHATE (AMP) BRONCHIAL PROVOCATION TEST AFFECT THE PERCEPTION OF DYSPNOEA?
trial_identification.scientifictitle: DOES USE OF INHALED FLUTICASONE PRIOR TO AN ADENOSINE 5'MONOPHOSPHATE (AMP) BRONCHIAL PROVOCATION TEST AFFECT THE PERCEPTION OF DYSPNOEA in asthmatic patients and the development of nasal symptoms?

interventions.interventions: Fluticasone 250mcg inhaled 2 or 14 hours before Adenosine 5' Monophostate Bronchial provocation. Perception of Dyspnoea and Nasal symptoms developed are recorded.

primaryOutcome.outcome: To investigate the acute effect of single dose of 250Âµg fluticasone propionate (FP) on perception of dyspnoea during AMP Bronchial provocative test, given 2 or 14hours pre test.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Effect of acutely inhaled FP on FEV1, EF25-75%, IC and FVC.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: All secondary outcomes are measured during and immediatly after the challenge.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Effect of AMP Bronchial Provocative test in development of nasal symptoms.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: All secondary outcomes are measured during and immediatly after the challenge.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Effect of acutely inhaled FP on the nasal symptoms.
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: All secondary outcomes are measured during and immediatly after the challenge.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Allergy to inhaled allergens. Mild asthma and rhinitis.

trial_design.concealment: Patients will attend the unit to receive the medication, they will be allocated to a treatment sequence which is described in the protocol. The sequence is concealed by allocating a number.
trial_design.sequence: Different combinations of FP2h, FP14 and Placebo 2 and 14 were organized. Subjects will receive an envelope that has a letter that identifies the sequence in which the medication will be given. The objective is to avoid the researcher is involved in the sequence selection and the patients are blinded to the order in which they will receive the medication.
